definition: to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
to explain/to release/Buddha (abbr. for 釋迦牟尼|释迦牟尼[Shi4 jia1 mou2 ni2])/Buddhism

sentences.english: Releasing the Sand turns back time.
sentences.chinese: 开释时之砂能够让时光倒流。

sentences.english: Tak your passion and mak it com tru.
sentences.chinese: 开释你的热情，让美梦成真。

sentences.english: Nosair and Davis, who wascharged with shooting six cops, were both acquitted.
sentences.chinese: 诺塞尔和戴维斯均无罪开释。

sentences.english: One child with a agitation was appear afterwards four hours, and again was apprenticed abroad in an ambucarve.
sentences.chinese: 四个小时后，一个发热的孩子被开释并由救护车带走。

sentences.english: The culture, is the sharable and valuable property released from human brains.
sentences.chinese: 文化者，人类心能所开释出来之有价值的共业也。

sentences.english: D. By comparing the proportion of life wiped out with the volume of lava produced.
sentences.chinese: 通功比拟水山开释出的熔岩的体积取宰生性命的比例。

sentences.english: Our incarceration rate is eight times that of France.
sentences.chinese: 我们的开释率是法国的八倍。

definition: restored to one's official post/to send sb back to his former post
to pardon/to absolve/to exempt from punishment
to release (a hostage)/to put back in place
